name: Kepler-392
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-392 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-392 is a star with 1.1839999999999997 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.13 times its radius. It is located 2266.98 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-392 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-392 b

Kepler-392 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 5.34 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-392.

The mass of Kepler-392 b is 0.96 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-392 b is 1 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, Kepler-392 b is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.

Kepler-392 c

Kepler-392 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 10.42 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-392.

The mass of Kepler-392 c is 1.21 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-392 c is 1.1 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, Kepler-392 c is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-392, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
